newsitem.title: LATVIA: KAIJA TO INVEST 1.22 MLN LATS IN 1997.
newsitem.headline: KAIJA TO INVEST 1.22 MLN LATS IN 1997.

text.p: Kaija fish cannery, which on Tuesday moved to the official list of the stock exchange, said it plans to invest some 1.22 million lats in developing both management and production this year.
One million of it will be spent on a new fish processing line, board member Gunar Vasks told a news conference.
Competition from Western and Russian producers in its main markets makes it necessary to adjust, Vasks said.
"With the new line we want to be first on the (Russian) market with a new product," he said.
"Kaija faces the need for a cardinal reconstruction within some three or four years," Vasks added.
Ave Lat Group, who holds a controlling stake in Kaija, has already invested 425,000 lats and plans to provide 900,000 more for new technologies within the coming two years, he said.
